column4: How do I check a filesystem? fsck told me at startup I failed the test
ok, but how can I get a more detailed filesystem check?
I'd like to stay with Ubuntu, thanks for the advice
but I would like to know how to get a detailed report on my filesystem with fsck
because it may be related to my vfat drive
you can try the -V flag to fsck.
from a terminal `info fsck` and you'll be able to find a lot of stuff you can use form the command line.
thank you, this will help a lot
Good luck... I've been working with linux for a long time, and never found a need for detail info on the filesystem, unless it was a post mortem... What do you want the info for?
or better yet, just what information do you want, fsck might not be the tool for the job.
to find out if this is my vfat drive that's going south
wait, no, it hung up on sda2 which is my ext3 part
yeah I'd like to see where it failed since my HDDs have been running for some time
So you want to know about the underlying drive or the filesystem itself?
the filesystem since it reported the fail on startup
then fsck is probably the tool... If you're concerned more about the disks themselves you can check out the smartmontools or smart-notifier packages.
thanks. I'll check those utils out.
